measured_by: Inventory of Parent and Peer Attachment (IPPA)
justification: The Methods section states that "relationship quality with parents and friends was assessed using the Inventory of Parent and Peer Attachment (IPPA; Armsden & Greenberg, 1987)."
The authors explain that "Social decision-making preferences were assessed using a suite of discounting decisions" that included delay and probabilistic discounting for monetary and social rewards.
In the Gambling Task description the paper notes that the task "is widely used ... to quantify subjects' loss and risk aversion," and prospect-theory parameters (λ) are estimated from this task.
The same Gambling Task section specifies that it allows researchers "to tease apart attitudes towards risk and loss," providing a risk-aversion parameter (ρ) derived from participants’ choices.
